pages.text: After experimenting a bit with alternative furnace concepts, I came up with the idea of making a kiln that can slowly melt materials in bulk all at the same time for relatively low amounts of fuel. With this device I can achieve the temperature needed to make bronze alloy as well as turning wood into charcoal without burning it up. I just need to carefully

ignite it and then I can estimate how much time it will take.$(br2)$(o)To operate the kiln, place fuel in the bottom slot and a valid material in the top slot, after that,  use an igniter(link) on the fuel and let it cook; Duration of the recipe displays on the bottom left corner/$
